name: vscode-uuid-generator
description: Generate UUIDs to insert into the current file, or onto the clipboard

commands.title: Insert new nil UUID (with all bits set to 0)

vscode-uuid-generator.contextMenu.enable.description: Whether to show the Insert new UUID function in the editor context menu

vscode-uuid-generator.uppercaseDigits.description: Use uppercase hex digits in UUID. Otherwise digits will be lowercase

vscode-uuid-generator.textSelection.description: Whether the inserted UUID text should be left in a selected state

enumDescriptions: No decoration around the UUID, e.g. 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000
Surround UUID with single quotes, e.g. '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000'
Surround UUID with double quotes, e.g. "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000"
Surround UUID with curly braces, e.g. {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}
Surround UUID with rounded braces, e.g. (00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000)
Surround UUID with square braces, e.g. [00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000]
vscode-uuid-generator.decorationStyle.description: Choose whether the generated UUID should be wrapped in braces ([{}]) or quotes "''"

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
